intro: Ruellia hirsutissima, commonly known as the hairy ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are ovate to lance-shaped, with a hairy texture that gives the plant its common name. Ruellia hirsutissima is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and prolonged flowering period.
